task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the T-shaped target, approach and align, then perform repeated short pushes toward the target until the block overlaps the target outline, and finally retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar whiteboard surface until it aligns with a fixed T-shaped target mark. The sequence begins with visual detection of both the block and the target, followed by a guarded approach to the block with tight in-plane alignment. The tool yaw is set for consistent pushing. The robot executes several short pushes, re-aligning between pushes, then verifies proximity to the target shape before retreating. Frequencies are 10 Hz for observation and control.
preconditions: Camera pose is calibrated to the robot frame.
End-effector is free and above the table.
Block and target are within the camera field of view.
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-shaped block and the target outline.
Move above the block and align in-plane.
Set tool yaw suitable for lateral pushes.
Execute repeated 0.1 m pushes to the right, re-aligning after each.
Refine alignment near the target and verify arrival.
success_criteria: Block centroid and orientation overlap the target outline within visual tolerance.
No loss of contact stability during final approach.
Robot ends away from the block without contact.
failure_and_recovery: If block/target not detected: invoke scan pattern search.
If push drifts orientation: re-run ApproachAndAlign before next push.
If near-target verification fails: add another push cycle followed by re-check.
task_long_description.termination: When IsAt(target="goal_T") succeeds after the final alignment, the robot retreats and the tree returns SUCCESS.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect the T-shaped block in the scene.
Line-scan search if the block is not immediately detected.
Fallback scan to localize the target.
Move above the block with a small vertical offset.
Guarded approach to achieve tight planar alignment against the block.
Orient the tool for lateral pushing.
Execute a short push to the right toward the target.
Re-establish contact and correct drift after each push.
Final alignment near the target outline.
Check that the block is within the target region.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Perception misses the block or target due to glare/occlusion.
Insufficient push distance to overcome static friction.
recovery_strategy: Repeat short push cycles with re-alignment between pushes.
Near-goal re-alignment and re-check with IsAt before terminating.
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue target outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—frames are treated as authoritative.
Workspace x-axis is to the right in images; Push uses direction_deg=0 accordingly.
Tool yaw of 90° provides a stable side contact given the cylindrical tip.
Timeouts chosen to fit ~10 Hz control without implying speed requirements.

expected_success_criteria: Block overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance and the robot retreats.
